text: <@U0UHG4VP1> what is the WFT template supposed to solve?
I see different workflow options, but we are missing some important things
like story points
stories
the transitions you were looking for (resolved and resolution)
epics
I'll remake the project as SCRUM give me a minute
ok
also, we need an in-review status
bah, we're in the middle of the update window, JIRA is down for a bit
would the monitor/on hold status work for that if renamed?
<@U0UHG4VP1> ping
<@U0UHG4VP1>: all nodes are showing up offline..
I've opened a ticket with our provider: <@U0KPFAZNF> <@U11HH3P7Y>
the interesting (to me) thing is it's hung on the step of copying the slave.jar file (which is ~750k). the same step on the sandbox is almost instant
this is a slightly wider issue - one other tenant (vm) is having this problem, and it's on another project.
<@U0UHG4VP1>: I was pinging about something else actually
re chaintool and gerrit
oh, sorry
no, not at all, I certainly wasnt specific
one challenge I hadnt really been considering is: we have all this software in the wild that already downloads the current GH release URLs
so, we need to tread carefully regarding the existing GH repo
(In addition to solving the problem of where future artifacts live
my question to you is: are you aware of a way to have hyperledger/fabric-chaintool be a mirror for gerrit AND retain the releases page?
(even if we freeze it for future artifacts)
i suspect it can: probably only a matter of perms
i have to step out for a while, but give it some thought
OK.
i know that the GH releases is still functional in things like fabric..it shows the tags that we push
i think the only difference is, I have permissions to attach artifacts to chaintool releases, whereas not anywhere else
i am thinking that perhaps when we move, you give yourself permission and ensure the ~10 releases we have currently have attached artifacts
and then, for future releases, we will use jenkins+nexus, etc
so it would just be a one time import
I'll need to play with that to see how it works.
(id be willing to do the leg work if you give me temporary perms, too)
ok, cool
have to run, ttyl
I didn't realize we still have fabric development outside of gerrit
sounds good
just chaintool to my knowledge
Any idea why CI isn't running on this one? <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/4621/>
(Or any of its child changesets as well for that matter.)
<@U0XQ35CDD>: CI is having issues with x86 nodes
there is an issue with our plugins
Roger. Can we post an update here when the issue is resolved so that I can restart the verification process on all pending changesets?
you shouldn't need to, I triggered all of them
what did I miss? there are two builds ongoing
<@U0UHG4VP1>: I thought I had to trigger manually, hence my comment above. You didn't miss anything, we're good - thank you.
